sage.terrain

Class TerrainBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Leaf
        • sage.scene.TriMesh
          • sage.terrain.TerrainBlock

  • public class TerrainBlock
extends TriMesh
    TerrainBlock defines a single section of terrain. A TerrainBlock is the lowest level of the terrain system; it is the actual part of the terrain system that renders to the screen. The terrain is built from a heightmap defined by a one dimensional int array; the heightmap array can be generated in any manner, including using one of the concrete subclasses of AbstractHeightMap.

    Each TerrainBlock has a set of scale factors which can be used to scale the block to a size larger than (or smaller than) the size defined by the underlying heightmap. However, if the terrain is to be large, it is recommended to make use of the TerrainPage class to subdivide the overall terrain object into pages for efficiency in rendering.

    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TerrainBlock

        public TerrainBlock(java.lang.String name,
                    int edgeSize,
                    graphicslib3D.Vector3D scaleFactor,
                    float[] heightMap,
                    graphicslib3D.Point3D origin)
        Constructs a new TerrainBlock defined by the specified parameters and with default values totalSize = edgeSize and texture offsets = 0. The parameters and heightmap data are then processed to generate a TriMesh object for rendering.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the terrain block.
        edgeSize - the edgeSize (in one direction) of the terrain block; normally the same as the size (in one direction) of the heightmap.
        scaleFactor - the scale factors for the terrain; each x,y,z component specifies the scale factor in the corresponding direction.
        heightMap - the height data.
        origin - the origin (location in world space) of the block.

      • TerrainBlock

        public TerrainBlock(java.lang.String name,
                    int edgeSize,
                    graphicslib3D.Vector3D scaleFactor,
                    float[] heightMap,
                    graphicslib3D.Point3D origin,
                    int totalSize,
                    float texOffsetS,
                    float texOffsetT,
                    float offsetAmount)
        Constructs a new TerrainBlock defined by the specified parameters. The parameters and heightmap data are then processed to generate a TriMesh object for rendering.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the terrain block.
        edgeSize - the edgeSize (in one direction) of the terrain block; normally the same as the size (in one direction) of the heightmap.
        scaleFactor - the scale factors for the terrain; each x,y,z component specifies the scale factor in the corresponding direction.
        heightMap - the height data.
        origin - the origin (location in world space) of the block.
        totalSize - the total edgeSize of the terrain (this is different from edgeSize if the block is part of a TerrainPage tree).
        texOffsetS - the offset in S for texture coordinates.
        texOffsetT - the offset in T for texture coordinates.
        offsetAmount - the total offset amount (used for texture coordinates).

    • Method Detail

      • setDetailTexture

        public void setDetailTexture(int unit,
                             float repeat)
        setDetailTexture copies the texture coordinates from the first texture channel to another channel specified by unit, multiplying by the factor specified by repeat so that the texture in that channel will be repeated that many times across the TerrainBlock.

        N.B.: this method is not currently implemented in Sage.

        Parameters:
        unit - channel to copy coords to
        repeat - number of times to repeat the texture across and down the block

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight(float x,
                       float z)
        getHeight() returns the height of a specified point (x,z) on the terrain block, relative to the origin of the terrain (that is, not relative to the terrain's world position).

        If the specified point is between terrain height point values, the height is linearly interpolated from the nearest height values.

        When mapping the specified (x,z) point onto the terrain, getHeight() takes into account any scale factor which was applied to the terrain height map during terrain construction. (In other words, the specified (x,z) location is interpreted as a point in the scaled version of the terrain.)

        If the specified point is not within the bounds of the (scaled) terrain, the value Float.NaN is returned. (Note that the Java language specification states that any relational operator (==, <, >, etc.) returns false when one or both of the operands is NaN. To determine if a value is NaN, use the method Float.isNaN().)

        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate in the terrain block
        z - the z coordinate in the terrain block
        Returns:
        the terrain height at (x,z), or NaN if (x,z) is not within the terrain boundaries
        See Also:
        getScaleFactor(), TerrainBlock(String, int, Vector3D, float[], Point3D)

      • getHeightFromWorld

        public float getHeightFromWorld(graphicslib3D.Point3D worldPosition)
        getHeightFromWorld() returns the height of an arbitrary point on the terrain when given world coordinates, if the (x,z) location of the specified world point is within the terrain boundary. If the point lies between height point values, the height is linearly interpolated. If the specified point is not within the bounds of the height map, the value Float.NaN is returned.

        This method operates by subtracting the current terrain origin from the specified world point and then passing the x and z coordinates of the resulting point to getHeight(float, float), returning the result of that method as the result of this method.

        Parameters:
        worldPosition - a position in world coordinates
        Returns:
        the terrain height at the (x,z) coordinates of the specified world position
        See Also:
        getHeight(float, float)

      • getSurfaceNormal

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getSurfaceNormal(graphicslib3D.Point3D position)
        getSurfaceNormal returns the normal of an arbitrary point on the terrain. The normal is linearly interpreted from the normals of the 4 nearest defined points. If the point provided is not within the bounds of the height map, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        position - the terrain location to find a normal at. Only the X and Z components are used.
        Returns:
        the normal vector at the specified position.

      • getSurfaceNormal

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getSurfaceNormal(float x,
                                               float z)
        getSurfaceNormal returns the normal of an arbitrary point on the terrain. The normal is linearly interpreted from the normals of the 4 nearest defined points and is returned as a normalized (unit length) Vector3D. If the point provided is not within the bounds of the terrain, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position on the terrain
        z - the z position on the terrain
        Returns:
        the normalized (unit length) normal at the specified position on the terrain

      • getHeightMap

        public float[] getHeightMap()
        Returns the height map this terrain block is using.
        Returns:
        This terrain block's height map.

      • getOffsetAmount

        Returns the offset amount this terrain block uses for textures.
        Returns:

      • getScaleFactor

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getScaleFactor()
        Returns the scale factor used to stretch the height map.
        Returns:

      • getTotalSize

        public int getTotalSize()
        Returns the total edgeSize of the terrain, which corresponds to the edgeSize of the heightmap (the total edgeSize may be larger than the terrain edgeSize in the case that the terrain block only covers a portion of the heightmap).
        Returns:
        The terrain's total edgeSize.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the edgeSize of this terrain block.
        Returns:
        The current block edgeSize.
        See Also:
        getTotalSize()

      • getOrigin

        public graphicslib3D.Point3D getOrigin()
        Returns a Point3D representing the world position of the origin of this TerrainBlock. The returned Point3D is a copy of the internal origin point, not a reference to the actual origin point.

      • setOrigin

        public void setOrigin(graphicslib3D.Point3D worldLocation)
        Sets the origin of this TerrainBlock to the specified world location (that is, moves the TerrainBlock to the specified location in the world).

      • setHeightMap

        public void setHeightMap(float[] heightMap)
        Sets the terrain block's height map and updates the terrain block vertex and normal data.
        Parameters:
        heightMap - The new height map.

        setHeightMapValue sets the value of this block's height map at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x coordinate in the heightmap
        z - - the z coordinate in the heightmap
        newVal - - the new value to be stored at (x,z) in the heightmap

      • updateFromHeightMap

        public void updateFromHeightMap()
        updateFromHeightMap() updates this TerrainBlock's vertices and normals from the current height map values. This method should be called after changing the height map stored in the TerrainBlock.

      • hasChanged

        public boolean hasChanged()
        Returns true if the height map in this TerrainBlock has changed since the last call to hasChanged().
        Returns:
        true if the heightmap has changed since the last call to this method or if this is the first call to this method; false otherwise.
